Systematic eye check at birth, 2 months, 4 months, between 9 and 24 months, 2-3 years, 5 years (6th<sup>year</sup>)

Very frequent anomalies: 1 in 5 children under 6 years of age

question.title: What is the recommended age for systematic eye checks in children?
question.description: Select the correct age range for systematic eye checks in children.

option_a.title: At birth, 2 months, and 4 months
option_a.description: Systematic eye checks at these ages are not typically recommended.

option_b.title: Between 9 and 24 months, and 2-3 years
option_b.description: This option is consistent with the recommended age range for systematic eye checks in children.

option_c.title: At 5 years (6th year) and 10 years
option_c.description: This option is not consistent with the recommended age range for systematic eye checks in children.

option_d.title: Every 6 months from birth to 6 years
option_d.description: This option is not consistent with the recommended age range for systematic eye checks in children.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter for the correct option.
